message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DS 

The paper deals with learning deep neural networks with hard-threshold activations, which is a problem in the field of machine learning. The paper specifically addresses the problem of learning networks of hard-threshold functions in a principled way, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of "Learning" (cs.LG). The paper also presents empirical results on classification accuracy for image datasets, which suggests that it may also fall under the sub-categories of "Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition" (cs.CV) and "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper deals with the problem of avoiding vanishing and exploding gradients, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of "Neural and Evolutionary Computing" (cs.NE). Finally, the paper presents a recursive mini-batch algorithm for learning deep hard-threshold networks, which involves optimization techniques, and thus may also fall under the sub-category of "Data Structures and Algorithms" (cs.DS).
